source.f9a1af11:
import time
import riiideducation
env = riiideducation.make_env()
source.f672c2c8:
%%time
for (test_df, sample_prediction_df) in iter_test:
    time.sleep(0.55)
    test_df['answered_correctly'] =  0
    env.predict(test_df.loc[test_df['content_type_id'] == 0, ['row_id', 'answered_correctly']])
source.67c7c3a2:
This is an experimental notebook. I examined how much processing time is allowed for inference.

From the Results, 0.55 sec/iter would be the limit.

Related Discussions

* https://www.kaggle.com/c/riiid-test-answer-prediction/discussion/194377
* https://www.kaggle.com/c/riiid-test-answer-prediction/discussion/192124

[update] Submission API is anounced to be updated (https://www.kaggle.com/c/riiid-test-answer-prediction/discussion/196210). 
I confirmed that the notebook with time.sleep(0.55) is submitted successfully after this update.
So, the limit would not be changed at least for this simple notebook.
source.e72a60ce:
* time.sleep(0.8) Submission error
* time.sleep(0.6) Submission error
* time.sleep(0.55) Success
* time.sleep(0.5) Success
* time.sleep(0.4) Success
source.02674ba3: There are 9x60x60/0.55=58,909 iterations in private dataset???
